page.title: 12Astonbury Dairy Farm
page.content: Nestled amongst lush green fields lies Astonbury Dairy Farm. Strong farm smell fill the air. No trace of Stevenage can be seen or heard. In the cowshed are 7 little fresian calves grazing. One is only two days old. There are 130 milking cows, and three bulls.The farm produces 450 gallons of milk daily.At6.00am and 3.00pm the cows are taken to the milking parlour. Next door the milk is pasteurised and bottled. The milk is then delivered by various independant milkmen around Aston, Bennington, and some parts of Stevenage the next morning. The con- sumer has to pay 23p per pint. Aston dairy farm has 2740 acres of land. 100 acres of land has wheat growing on it. The wheat supplies Mothers Pride bread The bottles are sterilized seven times.The farm is owned by Mr. Mick Williams.
